memberdef.name: GpuIndexIVFFlat

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a new instance with an empty flat quantizer; the user provides the number of lists desired.

briefdescription.para: Reserve GPU memory in our inverted lists for this number of vectors.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize ourselves from the given CPU index; will overwrite all data in ourselves
Copy ourselves to the given CPU index; will overwrite all data in the index instance
After adding vectors, one can call this to reclaim device memory to exactly the amount needed. Returns space reclaimed in bytes
Clears out all inverted lists, but retains the coarse centroid information

briefdescription.para: Trains the coarse quantizer based on the given vector data.
Returns the number of vectors present in a particular inverted list.

detaileddescription.para: Return the encoded vector data contained in a particular inverted list, for debugging purposes. If gpuFormat is true, the data is returned as it is encoded in the GPU-side representation. Otherwise, it is converted to the CPU format. compliant format, while the native GPU format may differ.
Return the vector indices contained in a particular inverted list, for debugging purposes.

briefdescription.para: Copy what we need from the CPU equivalent.
Copy what we have to the CPU equivalent.
Returns the number of inverted lists we're managing.
Return the quantizer we're using.
Sets the number of list probes per query.
Returns our current number of list probes per query.
Returns the device that this index is resident on.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to our GpuResources object that manages memory, stream and handle resources on the GPU
Set the minimum data size for searches (in MiB) for which we use CPU -> GPU paging

briefdescription.para: Returns the current minimum data size for paged searches.

memberdef.name: range_search

detaileddescription.para: query n vectors of dimension d to the index.
return all vectors with distance < radius. Note that many indexes do not implement the range_search (only the k-NN search is mandatory).

parameterdescription.para: input vectors to search, size n * d

detaileddescription.para: removes IDs from the index. Not supported by all indexes. Returns the number of elements removed.

memberdef.name: search_and_reconstruct

detaileddescription.para: Similar to search, but also reconstructs the stored vectors (or an approximation in the case of lossy coding) for the search results.
If there are not enough results for a query, the resulting arrays is padded with -1s.
Get a DistanceComputer (defined in AuxIndexStructures) object for this kind of index.
DistanceComputer is implemented for indexes that support random access of their vectors.
